availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: George W. Bailey (Hopkins County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Hopkins County, Kentucky, farmer. Virginia native. Married to Elizabeth Winstead Bailey. Father to Rebecca Bailey, Susan C. Bailey, Bushard D Bailey, Richard R. Bailey, John Bailey, George W. Bailey, William Bailey, and Waid H. Bailey. Farmer in Hopkins County in 1850. Owned two enslaved persons in Hopkins County in 1850. Farmer in Hopkins County in 1860. Owned two enslaved persons in Hopkins County in 1860. Employed Thomas May as a day laborer in 1860. Signed a bond of loyalty to the United States of America in Louisville, Kentucky, in 1864.
